definition: Chinatown/also called 唐人街[Tang2 ren2 jie1]
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua

sentences.english: He doctored in Chinatown for many years.
A Chinese dragon dance was performed in Philadelphia. This is the Chinese Cultural Center at the Chinatown of Philadelphia.
sentences.chinese: 費城舞起中國龍，這是聳立費場華埠的中華文化中心。

sentences.english: Early Images of Asian Men in Chinatown's "Bachelor Society".
sentences.chinese: 對華埠亞洲男性“光棍社會”的早期印象。

sentences.english: What are your favorite things about Chinatown (that you want to be sure stay the same)?
sentences.chinese: 在華埠，你最想保留甚麼東西？

sentences.english: The dark perfume of old Chinatown lingers in the air.
sentences.chinese: 古老華埠特有的濃郁氣息瀰漫在空氣中。

sentences.english: That is the problem we have with young people in Chinatown now.
sentences.chinese: 這就是華埠目前面臨的年輕人問題。

sentences.english: Then one night there was a fight right out on Tremont Street.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，在華埠街上發生了一場惡鬥。

definition: building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
(used in the names of grand buildings such as 百老匯大廈|百老汇大厦 Broadway Mansions (in Shanghai) or 帝國大廈|帝国大厦 Empire State Building etc)
ethnic Chinese/non-Chinese citizen of Chinese ancestry
to add to existing facilities or services
auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
